channel.title: Github Pages on bookdisorder
channel.description: Recent content in Github Pages on bookdisorder

item.title: Hello World, Part 2: Github Pages
item.description:
I launched this site three weeks ago, deploying a Hugo build to Github Pages. It was a steeper learning curve than I anticipated. Honestly, publishing anything is nerve-wracking - especially knowing every single change is out there for the world to see. I had to actively resist the urge to constantly fiddle with every little detail.

GitHub Pages Deployment

Getting the site live on GitHub Pages wasn’t entirely smooth. I had a simple HTML placeholder page sitting in my repository, which seemed to cause a delay. GitHub took a few minutes to recognize the new Hugo build after I pushed it. Turns out, understanding how GitHub Actions handles caching and updates requires a bit of research.
